name: N-(4-decylphenyl)-4-methylbenzamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2315
Reason: 4-decylphenyl and methylbenzamide functional groups are present in the compound under consideration. The decylphenyl group, which is a bulky and rigid structure, can increase the melting point due to its ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C. The methylbenzamide group can also contribute to the melting point due to its ability to form hydrogen bonds and increase molecular weight. The methyl group can raise the melting point by approximately +10°C due to its ability to participate in hydrogen bonding. The decyl group can also contribute to the melting point due to its ability to increase molecular weight and rigidity.
